title: Serif typeface with personality needed
content:
As the title says...  
Let me explain what I mean: I need the elegance of a serif font that will be used for titling on very large formats. So I want to have some innovative elements, to add more personality.  
Take a look at the attached image. Is the Didot Elder by Optimo. I was tempted to use this one, just because the small "g" and some caps are very interesting, but some serifs are a litte "diabolic" (look at the "s" and "z").  
Maybe can you suggest me another serif typeface with cool personality?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100612222742im_/http:/typophile.com/files/didotelder_5003.gif)
author: 4tm

comments.content: thank you, but too vert/horz contrasted for my purpose. is very similar to didot elder without the devilish elements. i'm ready to consider other style also.

[[http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=tribute&x=0&y=0|Tribute]] could be an option. [DTL Paradox](http://web.archive.org/web/20100612222742/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/) is probably less distinctive in comparison, but still may be worth looking at.
tribute is a good serif font. there is something of more original?

Have a look at [Hercules](http://web.archive.org/web/20100612222742/http:/www.paratype.com/mstore/fonts/Hercules.htm). The reg. is nice and thin but the text version has a good heavy feel and no quirky details. Very short descenders. Maybe not enough personality for you.

I'm actually trying to manually edit curves from an existing font. I think my meaning of original is hard to describe. When finished done i'll post some screenshot.  
So far, thank you to anyone.

[I feel exactly the same](http://web.archive.org/web/20100612222742/http:/typographica.org/000815.php) as you do about Didot Elder. I knew the arrow serifs would prevent it from being widely used. Ambroise is really your best alternative.

[[http://dstype.wordpress.com/2007/02/02/leitura-display/|Leitura Display]] and [Freight Big and/or Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20100612222742/http:/www.garagefonts.com/typespecimens_2.html?sku=GF060020X1P2&start=1) are pretty good (understatement).

Thank you to everyone, so far.  
I'm currently working to preview of my work.  
Feedback expected :)

4tm, due to your first Didot Typeface preference, I´ve tried **Didot from H&FJ**... What do you think?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100612222742im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hand_5162.gif)

Regards,

TypoPT
[Eidetic Neo](http://web.archive.org/web/20100612222742/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=eidetic+neo) has deliciously quirky details and a remarkable italic.

What about that one:

[http://www.dstype.com/andradepro.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100612222742/http:/www.dstype.com/andradepro.html "http://www.dstype.com/andradepro.html")

Andrade Pro from DSType

@ TypoPT: I take Didot Elder because his "strange" glyphs, and I was searching for something that could be original in the same way, but not devilish. Plain version of Didot is interesting but not so original...

Andrade Pro is awesome. I think all of DSTYPE are awesome.

By the way, I manually edited a font to create some original serif, and you can see it now :

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100612222742im_/http:/typophile.com/files/idea_5424.gif)
You might use a lot of "g's" but "z's". look at the big picture the characters you will most use.

4tm, you are right about DSType, Dino dos Santos is a portuguese typographer, so i know quite well his work! He has lot a sucess here at PT.  
Your "manual" exercise is almost there ... see again the "n", i think you must "condense it" a little more! But its just my eyes! :))
I used [Eplica](http://web.archive.org/web/20100612222742/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=LFT3020130) for a project a little while back and really liked it.
